question: Which Fast Patrol Vessel has recently been delivered to Indian Coast Guard by GRSE?
explanation: Garden Reach Shipbuilders and Engineers Ltd (GRSE) on November 18 delivered to the Indian Coast Guard ICGS \'Amrit Kaur\', the third in a series of five \'Fast Patrol Vessels\' (FPV). The warship builder delivered the ship within a time gap of only 14 days from November 5, when ICGS \'Annie Besant\' was handed over to the Coast Guard. ICGS \'Amrit Kaur\' is a 50-metre-long and 7.5-metre- wide medium-range surface vessel, with displacement of around 308 tonne. It is capable of performing rescue, patrolling, anti-smuggling and anti-poaching operations in the maritime zones of the country.
